definition: an implement used to cut, lift, and turn over soil especially in preparing a seedbed
any of various devices (such as a snowplow) operating like a plow
to turn, break up, or work with a plow
to make (something, such as a furrow) with a plow
to cut into, open, or make furrows or ridges in with or as if with a plow

to cleave the surface of or move through (water)                                      
             
             whales plowing the ocean

to clear away snow from with a snowplow                                      
             
             plow the street

to spend or invest (money) in substantial amounts                                      
                
                  —used with into          plow money into stocks
to use a plow
to undergo plowing

to move forcefully into or through something                                      
             
             the car plowed into a fence

to proceed steadily and laboriously                                      
             
             had to plow through a stack of letters
a piece of farm equipment that is used to dig into and turn over soil especially to prepare the soil for planting
to dig into or break up (dirt, soil, land, etc.) with a plow
to use a snowplow to remove snow from a road, parking lot, etc.
to move through, over, or across (something) in a forceful and steady way
a farm machine used to dig into, break up, and turn over soil
a device (as a snowplow) used to spread or clear away matter on the ground

to dig into, break up, or turn over soil with a plow                                      
             
             plow a furrow

to move through or continue with force or determination                                      
             
             Our ship plowed through the waves.
in: whales plowing the ocean
plow the street
plow money into stocks
the car plowed into a fence
had to plow through a stack of letters
The soil was freshly plowed.
They used oxen to plow the field.
My street hasn't been plowed yet.
We hired someone to plow the snow from our driveway.
The town won't start plowing until the storm is almost over.
a ship plowing the ocean
They continued to plow their way through the tall grass.
plow a furrow
plow the soil
Our ship plowed through the waves.
